intro: Borreria verbenoides f. prima, commonly known as the Mexican mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has aromatic, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
